title: Quick Sort
algorithmDescription: Sort array using quick sort with partition and pivot selection
detailedDescription: Implement quick sort algorithm. Input: First line has n, second line has n space-separated integers. Output: Sorted array. Quick sort uses partitioning: select pivot, partition array so elements < pivot are left, > pivot are right. Recursively sort partitions.
hints: Partition: rearrange so elements < pivot are left, >= pivot are right
Recursively apply to left and right partitions
In-place sorting with O(log n) space for recursion
commonMistakes: Poor pivot selection leading to O(nÂ²) worst case
solutionApproach: Select pivot (e.g., last element). Partition array: iterate through array, swap elements < pivot to left side. Place pivot at partition point. Recursively quick sort left and right partitions.
testCaseCriteria: Must correctly sort using quick sort. Should demonstrate O(n log n) average case. Must use partitioning and recursion.
sampleCode:
def partition(arr, low, high):
    pivot = arr[high]
    i = low
    for j in range(low, high):
        if arr[j] <= pivot:
            arr[i], arr[j] = arr[j], arr[i]
            i += 1
    arr[i], arr[high] = arr[high], arr[i]
    return i


def quick_sort(arr, low, high):
    if low < high:
        pi = partition(arr, low, high)
        quick_sort(arr, low, pi - 1)
        quick_sort(arr, pi + 1, high)


n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
quick_sort(arr, 0, len(arr) - 1)
print(" \".join(map(str, arr)))
